      If resources for tack hadn't been initialized in .xml file or constructor was only with Context argument this method allows to set up Tack textures after creating instance of MapDrawer.

    • Method Detail

      • showFloor

        public void showFloor(int floor)
        Setting map to be drawn on canvas and getting dimensions from bitmap to set up scale parameters If floor exceeds size of floors list method gets the last one floor map possible
        Parameters:
        floor - number of the floor to be drawn

      • showPoint

        public void showPoint(MapPoint point)
        Zoom view on given point. Floor will be changed if needed. Zoom is equal to scaleDetectorMAX
        Parameters:
        point - point to center on and zoom

      • addTackResources

        public void addTackResources(int defaultTackId,
                             int startTackId,
                             int endTackId)
        If resources for tack hadn't been initialized in .xml file or constructor was only with Context argument this method allows to set up Tack textures after creating instance of MapDrawer.
        Parameters:
        startTackId - id of drawable which will be set to starting points
        endTackId - id of drawable which will be set to ending points
        defaultTackId - id of drawable which will be set for default points

      • setMaxScale

        public void setMaxScale(float maxScale)
        Setting max scale. Keep in mind that too big scale can cause problems with rendering on canvas.
        Parameters:
        maxScale - scale which will be set a maximal

      • setMinScale

        public void setMinScale(float minScale)
        Setting minimum scale allowed.
        Parameters:
        minScale - scale which will be set as minimal

      • setModel

        public void setModel(MapModel model)
        Method sets model which will be used to get maps textures.
        Parameters:
        model - object that implements MapModel interface

      • addMapPoint

        public void addMapPoint(MapPoint tack,
                        java.lang.Integer type)
        Add mappoint which will be drawn immediately with previous added tacks.
        Parameters:
        tack - mappoint with x and y coordinates
        type - determines the texture set to given point

      • removeAllMapPoints

        public void removeAllMapPoints()
        Clear mappoint arraylist

      • removeMapPoint

        public void removeMapPoint(MapPoint mapPoint)
        Remove object from map
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - object to remove

      • setTrace

        public void setTrace(java.util.ArrayList<MapPoint> trace)
        Set trace to be drawn as path to destined place
        Parameters:
        trace - array of mappoints to be drawn

      • removeTrace

        public void removeTrace()
        Clear trace to be drawn as path to destined place
